node.title: More people giving up on owning property, says Sharesies
node.description: Sharesies' annual survey showed 27 percent of respondents did not want to own a property, more than double the level of the past three years.

node.title: Athletes facing big challenge from online abuse
node.description: Stopping the racist, sexist, homophobic and other online abuse increasingly directed at professional athletes is a challenge facing all sports.

node.title: Vaccine mandate: 'Incredible pressure' on remaining hospital staff
node.description: Health sector staff will be under further pressure as the strained system deals with the loss of 1300 workers who are not vaccinated, say health experts.

node.title: Getting Personal With Iman
node.description: The supermodel talks about life after David Bowie, their Catskills refuge and the perfume inspired by their love.

node.title: Think Biden’s a Bust? Check Your Cynicism.
node.description: Can we give the legislation that the president signed on Monday its due?

node.title: I Was Afraid of the Bike Path. So I Hired a Bike Coach.
node.description: A nasty crash instilled a phobia of bollards. I called the Bike Whisperer.

node.title: Five schools move their classes online as Kenosha awaits a Rittenhouse verdict.
node.description: In a letter to parents, the schools — all within a short distance of the Kenosha County Courthouse or the downtown area — cited the trial as the reason for the switch.

node.title: Colorado Wildfire Kills One, Signaling Fire Season Is Far From Over
node.description: The Kruger Rock fire in Northern Colorado has burned about 145 acres, fire officials said. A plane carrying fire suppressant crashed this week, killing the pilot.

node.title: Wife of Missing Chinese Official Calls Government a 'Monster,' 'They Eat Their Children'
node.description: "During the past three years, I learned—just like we know how to live with the COVID—I know how to live with the monster, the authority," Grace Meng said.

node.title: Over 500K Students, Some With COVID, Take Hours-Long College Entrance Test in South Korea
node.description: The Suneung, also known as the College Scholastic Ability Test, determines what university students attend and is critical for their social standing.

node.title: Philippines Warns China of U.S. Defense Treaty After Water Cannon Fired at Filipino Boats
node.description: Chinese coast guard water-cannoned Philippine supply ships at the disputed Second Thomas Shoal, prompting Filipino officials to remind them of a U.S. treaty.

node.title: What Zelle, Cashapp, Others IRS Reporting of $600 Payments Means for Businesses
node.description: Though the new rule will go into effect on January 1, businesses will see the impact in 2023 when they file their 2022 tax returns.

node.title: Could Stacey Abrams Beat Joe Biden in 2024? What Polls Show About Potential Rivals
node.description: Abrams helped deliver a Democratic victory in Georgia and has presidential aspirations, but she's not yet Democrats first choice for 2024.

node.title: GOP Still Wants Trump to Run in 2024 Despite Majority of Country Saying Otherwise: Poll
node.description: In a new poll by Marquette University Law School, over 70 percent of total respondents said they did not want to see Trump on the ballot in 2024.

node.title: Internet Falls in Love With Wholesome 'Old Trucker' and His Rescue Kitten Bobbie
node.description: The videos of "Old Trucker" and his companion, Bobbie, have been viewed millions of times on TikTok.

node.title: 14-Year-Old to Be Tried as Adult After Allegedly Attempting to Shoot Deputies in Standoff
node.description: The 14-year-old girl and a 12-year-old boy allegedly broke into a home and opened fire on the responding Volusia County Sheriff's deputies.

node.title: Doubts cast on authenticity of statement from Peng Shuai
node.description: The head of the Women's Tennis Association has cast doubt on an email released by Chinese state media attributed to tennis player Peng Shuai.

node.title: Tui Oil Field decommissioning contract awarded
node.description: Helix Offshore Services has been awarded for final phase of the decommissioning of the Tui Oil Field off the coast of Taranaki.

node.title: U.S. lines up deal with Pfizer for COVID-19 treatment pill
node.description: The pharmaceutical giant has asked the federal regulators to authorize the experimental pill​, called Paxlovid.

node.title: I Spoke to C.E.O.s About the Future of Work
node.description: Big companies are struggling with how, when and even if they will bring employees back to the office.

node.title: Surgeon Who Removed Woman's 44lb Tumor Warns Against Ignoring Symptoms
node.description: The tumor is known as a uterine fibroid, which can cause symptoms like stomach swelling, menstrual changes and pain.

node.title: 130 Afghans, All Connected to Soccer Team, Leave on Flight Funded by Kim Kardashian West
node.description: Following the Taliban takeover of Afghanistan's government in August, women playing sports is now seen as a political act of defiance in the country.

node.title: Belarus Border Camp Emptied, Hundreds of Migrants Flown Back to Iraq
node.description: Belarusian authorities said that as many as 7,000 migrants remain in the country after more than a week of tensions between it, the migrants and Poland.

node.title: U.S. Warns Citizens in Ethiopia to Leave, Says There Will Be No Afghanistan-Type Evac
node.description: The United States warned pilots they could be directly or indirectly exposed to ground weapons fire at the busiest airport in Africa from the Ethiopian war.

node.title: As Rittenhouse Jury Deliberates, Jacob Blake Wants Media Attention to Die Down
node.description: Blake said he hopes that regardless of the verdict, people in Kenosha won't riot in response: "It's not going to fix anything."

node.title: Paul Gosar Shares New Photoshopped Anime With AOC, Dems Vs. Trump GOP After Censure Vote
node.description: The Arizona Republican congressman doubled down on his use of anime to depict violence between the GOP and Democrats.

node.title: Kim Kardashian West helps fly Afghan women soccer players to U.K.

node.title: Gillian Wearing Is Spilling Your Secrets
node.description: What makes this British Turner Prize winner maddening also makes her fascinating. Now her confessional art is on view in “Wearing Masks,” her first American museum retrospective.

node.title: Oprah Winfrey and Reese Witherspoon join in a private equity takeover of Spanx.

node.title: Olympic Committee Believes Tennis Star Peng Shuai is 'Safe,' as WTA Head Demands Answers
node.description: "The WTA and the rest of the world need independent and verifiable proof that she is safe," wrote Steve Simon, chairman and CEO of WTA.

node.title: Biden's Approval Rating Hits New Low as Most Disapprove of His Handling of COVID, Economy
node.description: Seven in 10 Americans said rising prices are causing them to change their spending habits.

node.title: Cenk Uygur Calls Joe Rogan 'Meathead' As Feud Reignites
node.description: "The Young Turks" founder said the podcast host was pushing the "same right-wing slop that everyone else does" in a series of tweets.

node.title: John Deere Workers Each Given $8,500 Bonus as Company Buckles to Strike Demands
node.description: The employees will receive an immediate pay increase of 10 percent after agreeing to a new six-year deal.

node.title: How to watch longest partial lunar eclipse
node.description: The moon will move into Earth's shadow for 3 hours and 28 minutes this month.

node.title: ‘Jagged’ Review: The Painful Road to Era-Defining Success
node.description: This documentary from Alison Klayman catalogs the odds that Alanis Morissette overcame to make her 1995 hit album “Jagged Little Pill.”

node.title: ‘The Princess Switch 3’ Review: Meow, It’s Fiona’s Turn
node.description: A golden star on loan from the Vatican to crown the holiday tree in tiny Montenaro has been stolen. What’s a royal family to do?

node.title: Kim Kardashian helps Afghanistan's women's youth development soccer team flee to UK
node.description: After weeks in limbo waiting for a flight out of Pakistan, about 30 teenage players and 100 members of their families land in the UK, thanks to a trio of benefactors.

node.title: Julius Jones' family begs for clemency as execution nears
node.description: Jones was sentenced to death almost 20 years ago for the murder of Paul Howell, but Jones has always maintained his innocence.

node.title: Macy’s raises its full-year outlook after strong third-quarter sales.
node.description: The retailer said its sales for the three months ended Oct. 30 were $5.4 billion, and it posted a net profit of $239 million.

node.title: What We Know About Delta AY.4.2 COVID Variant as Study Suggests It Causes Fewer Symptoms
node.description: The variant may spread faster than the original form of Delta, which is now the most dominant strain in the world.

node.title: Julius Jones Says He Forgives Howell Family Ahead of Execution: 'I Pray for Them Constantly'
node.description: Jones, a 41-year-old Black man from Oklahoma, is set to be executed on Friday for the murder and carjacking of Paul Howell in 1999.

node.title: Beto O'Rourke vs. Greg Abbott: What Polls Say About the Texas Governor's Race
node.description: Although the GOP incumbent's rating remains underwater, recent polls show Abbott ahead of his Democratic challenger.

node.title: What does living with COVID look like? Europe's bleak winter is the world's worst case scenario
node.description: The days in the northern hemisphere are growing short and cold, allowing the Delta variant to take hold as people retreat indoors, while vaccine immunity wanes and inoculation rates stagnate.

node.title: What's in Democrats' new $1.75 trillion social spending bill?
node.description: The White House unveiled a new framework for the legislation after protracted negotiation among Democrats.

node.title: The Moment That Janet Jackson’s Career Stalled and Justin Timberlake’s Soared
node.description: Jackson was vilified after her 2004 Super Bowl halftime show, while Timberlake’s popularity seemed to take off. Our new documentary examines how the superstars were treated after their unforgettable wardrobe malfunction.

node.title: Here’s a guide to who’s who in the Rittenhouse courtroom.
node.description: A rundown of the key figures for the trial of Kyle Rittenhouse in Kenosha, Wis.

node.title: Freezing, Hungry Migrants Trapped Between East and West, Belarus and Poland
node.description: The migrants are caught between Belarus, an ally of neighboring Russia on its eastern border; and Poland to the west, a member of EU and NATO.

node.title: Angler Almost Ate Record-Breaking 18lb Fish Caught in Pennsylvania River

node.title: Kyle Rittenhouse jury resumes deliberations after asking to re-watch video
node.description: Issues surrounding the video prompted the defense to again call for a mistrial.​

node.title: Four Years After ‘Unite the Right,’ Charlottesville Still Struggles to Move On
node.description: Many residents hoped the town would become an example of racial reconciliation. It hasn’t happened.

node.title: China Believes Its 'Time Has Come' to Return to Power, Singapore PM Says
node.description: Lee Hsien Loong said he doesn't believe conflict over Taiwan is imminent, but the risk of a "mishap" remains.

node.title: Hong Kong kills wild boars after police officer, others attacked
node.description: Last week, a wild boar knocked down a police officer and bit his leg before plunging to its death from a residential car park.

node.title: OSHA suspends enforcement of new employer vaccine rule
node.description: The federal agency said it is complying with a court ruling that temporarily halts the regulation for big employers.

node.title: Don't expect many deep online discounts for Black Friday
node.description: Inflation is also pushing up prices for online shoppers. That's likely to make holiday bargains harder to find.

node.title: Jobless claims drop seventh straight week to new pandemic low
node.description: About 268,000 people filed for unemployment benefits last week, while 2.1 million Americans remain on jobless aid.

node.title: Bill to honor troops killed in Kabul airport attack sent to Biden
node.description: The House passed the bill in October, and the Senate passed it Wednesday.

node.title: The T List: Six Things We Recommend This Week
node.description: A new theater district hotel, a perfume subscription service — and more.

node.title: Review: This ‘Wheel of Time’ Goes Nowhere Fast
node.description: Amazon’s ambitious fantasy adaptation is bursting with magic and monsters, but it’s no heir to the “Thrones.”

node.title: N.C.A.A. Expands Division I Women’s Basketball Tournament
node.description: Beginning with the competition in March 2022, the women’s bracket will include 68 teams, up from 64, as the N.C.A.A. continues to try to rectify gender disparities.

node.title: Where to Stargaze in the U.S.
node.description: Since 2001, the International Dark-Sky Association has designated spots with exceptionally high-quality night skies, in an effort to restore them to their natural state.

node.title: Homes for Sale in Brooklyn and Manhattan
node.description: This week’s homes are in Greenwood Heights, Midtown East and on the Upper East Side.

node.title: Homes for Sale in New York and Connecticut
node.description: This week’s properties are a four-bedroom in Manhasset, N.Y., and a five-bedroom in Westport, Conn.

node.title: Salzburg is poised to impose a general lockdown as Covid spreads in Austria.
node.description: The state, along with neighboring Upper Austria, will apply the restrictions to everyone regardless of inoculation status. The moves come in the wake of national rules affecting unvaccinated people.

node.title: Fury in Kashmir After Deadly Police Raid at Shopping Complex
node.description: Saying that the men killed in a gun battle were separatist militants or “terrorist supporters,” security forces refused to return the bodies to their families.

node.title: Man Who Pleaded Guilty to Raping Four Teenage Girls Receives No Jail Time
node.description: Niagara County Court Judge Matthew Murphy said he "agonized" over Christopher Belter's sentencing before deciding prison time would be "inappropriate."

node.title: Kamala Harris Says She and Joe Biden 'Absolutely Not' Discussing 2024 Re-Election
node.description: The president told reporters in March that it's his "expectation" to seek re-election, and that he would "fully expect" Harris to be his running mate.

node.title: 15 reportedly killed as Sudan military rulers crack down on protests
node.description: The deaths, only one of which Sudan's post-coup regime acknowledges, came on the deadliest day since generals toppled the civilian government, and amid increasing outcry from the U.S.

node.title: U.S. and G7 demand Belarus end "callous" migrant crisis with Poland
node.description: Belarus opens shelter, flies some migrants and refugees home, but suffering continues for thousands caught in the Russian-backed nation's "hybrid" battle with the West.

node.title: Jennifer Packer: Painting as an Exercise in Tenderness
node.description: In a virtuosic solo show at the Whitney, the artist finds her subjects’ complex humanity, and offers a new way forward for representation.

node.title: Will Elizabeth Holmes Testify in the Theranos Trial?
node.description: The prosecution is expected to wrap its case soon.

node.title: How Donald Trump Is Purging GOP of Those Who Voted to Impeach: '2 Down, 8 To Go!'
node.description: The former president is using his major GOP influence to have those he disproves of removed from office in the 2022 midterms.

node.title: Victoria opens up as state nears 90pc vaccination milestone
node.description: Victorians embrace post-lockdown life as restrictions ease substantially in the state, offering even more freedoms than in neighbouring New South Wales.

node.title: 'Pure discrimination' against Q+A guest's daughter panned by disability advocate
node.description: Whether Australia endures a "great resignation" remains a future issue but issues of workplace discrimination and gender equality are placed squarely in the spotlight on a Q+A that ends with some sad news.

node.title: Activists are fighting to stop the execution of Julius Jones
node.description: Julius Jones, 41, is scheduled to be executed by lethal injection on Thursday.

node.title: Texas mayor: Federal civil rights probe may be politically motivated
node.description: Southlake, Texas Mayor John Huffman noted that the Department of Education investigation of the city's Carroll school district follows the district's decision not to teach critical race theory.

node.title: How to Watch the 2021 Latin Grammy Awards Tonight
node.description: The 22nd annual Latin Grammys will be shown live on Thursday at 8 p.m. Eastern on Univision. Gloria Estefan, Rubén Blades, Camilo and more are scheduled to perform.

node.title: President Biden’s O.C.C. pick declares her support for capitalism and community banks.
node.description: Saule Omarova, a Cornell Law School professor, faces an unusually strident campaign against her nomination.

node.title: With restrictions easing, the Australian Open can play before a full house.
node.description: The annual Boxing Day cricket test match in Melbourne will also be allowed to take place before a full-capacity crowd.

node.title: Dubious Peng Shuai Letter Sparks Fears About Chinese Tennis Star's Safety
node.description: Steve Simon, head of the Women's Tennis Association, said the email had left him more concerned about the wellbeing of the 35-year-old player.

node.title: Man who shot Ahmaud Arbery: "This was a life-or-death situation"
node.description: Arbery, a 25-year-old Black man, was killed in February 2020.

node.title: Man accused of lacing wife's cereal with heroin convicted of murder
node.description: Christina Harris' 2014 death was initially ruled an accidental overdose but investigators later alleged that it was a murder scheme hatched by Jason Harris.

node.title: House votes to censure Congressman Paul Gosar for violent video
node.description: Gosar is the 24th lawmaker in U.S. history to be censured.

node.title: Could Biden's spending plans push inflation even higher?
node.description: The infrastructure bill and Build Back Better Act could pour $3 trillion into the economy just as inflation is surging.

node.title: ‘Black Friday’ Review: Killer Sales Bring Killer Customers
node.description: In this horror-comedy, a group of resentful retail workers struggle to survive as shoppers overtaking their toy store are ravaged by a zombie plague.

node.title: ‘Procession’ Review: Art as Exorcism
node.description: In this experimental documentary streaming on Netflix, six survivors of abuse within the Catholic Church use filmmaking to confront traumatic memories.

node.title: ‘I Was a Simple Man’ Review: Letting Go
node.description: A Hawaiian man’s memories catch up with him as he nears death in Christopher Makoto Yogi’s spiritually infused twilight drama.

node.title: ‘India Sweets and Spices’ Review: Gossip, Secrets and Biting Laughs
node.description: A party invitation exposes a family and a community in this Geeta Malik feature starring Sophia Ali.

node.title: ‘Tick, Tick … Boom!’ Review: A Bohemian’s Rhapsodies
node.description: Andrew Garfield stars as Jonathan Larson, the composer and lyricist of “Rent,” in this meta-musical directed by Lin-Manuel Miranda.

node.title: ‘Kurt Vonnegut: Unstuck in Time’ Review: An Idol Shares the Camera
node.description: Fans of Tralfamadore and more are escorted through the author’s reminiscences, but the focus is swiveled a bit to take in the tour guide himself.

node.title: ‘The First Wave’ Review: How to Fight a Virus
node.description: The documentary tracks the first four months of the novel coronavirus in March 2020, as it overwhelms works at a hospital in Queens.

node.title: ‘Bad Luck Banging or Loony Porn’ Review: No Sex, Please, We’re Romanian
node.description: A viral video scandal ensnares a Bucharest schoolteacher in Radu Jude’s biting, bawdy and brilliant Covid-age fable.

node.title: ‘She Paradise’ Review: Coming of Age Through Soca
node.description: A teenager living in poverty in Trinidad and Tobago joins a dance group to make money, but she soon realizes success comes at a cost.

node.title: ‘Zeros and Ones’ Review: Plague and Paranoia
node.description: Abel Ferrara’s lockdown experiment is a spooky political thriller with a double dose of Ethan Hawke.

node.title: N.H.L. Partnership With Chemical Company Leaves Environmental Watchdogs Cold
node.description: A new report accuses the league of using its N.H.L. Green program to promote refrigerants that will contribute to global warming.

node.title: All Eyes Are on the Nation’s Ports. Can Truck Drivers Make the Most of It?
node.description: The supply-chain crisis has opened a rare opportunity for them to agitate for a better life.

node.title: Germany moves to impose new pandemic regulations amid record case numbers.
node.description: The measures include a rule that only those who are vaccinated, have recovered from an infection or test negative can ride public transit or attend work in person.

node.title: How SpaceX's Huge Starship Rocket Compares to Others As Elon Musk Eyes January Launch
node.description: The colossal rocket will one day be tasked with carrying humans to Mars and maybe beyond, the SpaceX founder and CEO has said.

node.title: Huge Herd of Over 100 Giraffes Filmed in Amazing Encounter
node.description: Exaud Marandu of Utopia Safaris said it is only the second time in 20 years he has seen such a large collection of one of Africa's iconic animals.

node.title: Presidential Turkey Pardon 2021: Thanksgiving Turkey Presentation Date, Time and History
node.description: U.S. presidents have been presented with turkeys from as far back as the 19th century during the presidency of Ulysses S. Grant.

node.title: Two Americans Gunned Down Outside District Attorney's Office in Mexico
node.description: The victims, aged 31 and 61, were attacked in the border city of Ciudad Juárez.
